clinical_study.brief_title: Intranasal Dexmedetomidine VS Oral Chloral Hydrate for Rescue Sedation During Magnetic Resonance Imaging

lead_sponsor.agency: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

clinical_study.source: Guangzhou Women and Children's Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this investigation was to test the hypothesis that intranasal dexmedetomidine is as effective as second dose of oral chloral hydrate for rescue sedation in infant age between 1 and 6 months who were not adequately sedated following initial dose of chloral hydrate.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hours after MRI scaning
primary_outcome.description: Sedation status was evaluated by a attending anesthesiologists every 5-10 min with a 6-point sedation scale, which was modified from the Observer Assessment of Alertness and Sedation Scale (MOAA/S; Table 1). successful sedation was defined as an MOAA/S of between 0 and 3

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 min after rescue drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Successful sedation was defined as an MOAA/S of between 0 and 2, and sedation induction time was defined as the time from rescue drug administration to the onset of satisfactory sedation 0 Does not respond to a noxious stimulus Does not respond to mild prodding or shaking Responds only after mild prodding or shaking Responds only after name is called loudly orrepeatedly Lethargic response to name spoken in normal tone Appears asleep, but responds readily to namespoken in normal tone Appears alert and awake, responds readily to namespoken in normal tone

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 hours after rescue drug administration
secondary_outcome.description: Children were classified as awake if the MOAA/S was between 4 and 6. Wake -up time was defined as the time from successful sedation until the time that the child awoke

other_outcome.time_frame: baseline, before and 15 , 30, 60, 75, 90 min after rescue drug administration
other_outcome.description: changes in the non-invasive systolic blood pressure at the baseline, before and 15 , 30, 60, 75, 90 min after rescue drug administration

other_outcome.time_frame: baseline, before and 15 , 30, 60, 75, 90 min after rescue drug administration
other_outcome.description: changes in heart rates at the baseline, before and 15 , 30, 60, 75, 90 min after rescue drug administration

other_outcome.time_frame: baseline and four hours after rescue medicine administration
other_outcome.description: Significant Oxyhemoglobin desaturation was defined as<94%

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 160 children of ASA physical status I or II, aged between 1 and 6 months, failed chloral hydrate sedation during MRI scanning
Exclusion Criteria:
- known allergy or hypersensitive reaction to dexmedetomidine or CH, organ dysfunction, pneumonia, acute upper respiratory airway inflammation, preterm, cardiac arrhythmia or and congenital heart disease.
